channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023120623
item.description:
Report X-2023120623

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet along one of the edges. It was found that 2 of the bottles had loose caps resulting in the leakage. The original TRK ID was 787135748837, but it was a duplicate package. A 998 was created to RTS, but it was then damaged. DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in a lined red tote

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer when set on rollers the top closure of the package was open with a drum leaking white powder. item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and was immediately placed into bag in order to prevent further white liquid spill. Appears cans from inside had been moving around that may have caused dent on one can. The dent caused closures of lid of bottle to open up and allow liquid substance to leak inside package damaging other container as well. DescribePack: Dent on paint can causing lid to open DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright according to directional arrows and placed inside a plastic bag as well as proper drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: I WAS NOTIFIED BY THE MANAGER OF A HAZ MAT SPILL. THE HAZ MAT WAS LAYING HORIZONTALLY INSTEAD OF VERTICALLY, AS INDICATED BY THE ARROW ON THE PKG. THERE WERE 2 BOTLLES IN THE PKG., ONCE COMPLETELY LEAKED. DescribePack: PKG WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE CAUSING IT TO LEAK FOM THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG. WAS PLACED INSIDE A PLASTIC TOTE BY MANAGEMENT TO CONTAIN THE SPILL.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE CRUSHED AND GIVING OFF AN ODOR OF ALCOHOL. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT, INADEQUATE BLOCK AND BRACE. ALL BOTTLES DENTED TO VARYING DEGREES. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED A TENTH OF A GALLON FROM CRUSHED BODY AND CAP ASKEW. SPILL LONG SINCE DRIED OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023120930
item.description:
Report X-2023120930

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler accidentally dropped the box and caused bottle to break. Manager immediately had the package handlers working the area to clear out and vented out the area. Once area was completely vented out QA and Managers worked together to safely retrieve the box and place in vent and used absorbent to clean up rest of spill. DescribePack: top of glass bottle inside box broke completely causing the liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleared out and vented out by opening trailer doors and using fans. Source of leak was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent and safely taken to vent.

The release impacted trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 8 gallon poly drum was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
